content: I'm really not sure what to do with GF#17000
or GF#16999
I guess we could say 'we agree, thanks for your comment'?
They're "A-C" ballots. The only thing you can really do with them is block vote them as "Considered - No action required".

we're not putting neg-mj issues in block votes? or can we?
(candidates: GF#16470, GF#16460, GF#16457, GF#16456, GF#16450, GF#16329, GF#16316, GF#16313, GF#14298, GF#17037, GF#16310, GF#14027, GF#16318)

ok. FHIR-I curently has 145 undisposed issues from the core normative ballot. I have put 93 of them in a block vote (block vote 3). The rest are either in
- ready to vote (16)
- fit for teleconference (20)
- normative-substantiative (5)

  • there's a few waiting for input

only one of the block vote items is labelled as 'in-person' and that is a persuasive affirmative
.. please can we dispose neg-mj in the block vote...

No problem with disposing of negatives in the block vote. Where it gets trickier is if they're "in person". For those, we need to engage with the balloter and confirm that they're ok with the block vote resolution. Alternatively we schedule a call where they can say their piece.
Did you look at the non-ballot ones?
doing non ballot ones next

the problem with in-person is that there's a fundamental inequity here. Some balloters made very thoughtful comments that will make us think hard, calling them affirmative and not in -person, while other people made typo's as in-person neg-mj. We really need some way to say 'no, you can't waste committee time like that'
anyway, I'll move some of the neg-mj into the block vote
If we find something persuasive (e.g. a typo), in-person doesn't apply.
Note that Neg-Mj is just really "Neg" now - we no longer distinguish major and minor.
so your comments remain too dense. 14027 - does the comment mean that this is the clone, or that this is the original to call out of scope?
This one is the incorrectly-submitted ballot and is marked as Not Related. The clone wouldn't be tied to a ballot and will be dispositioned normally
ok. I figured this out. but using some prepositions will make it easier for people in the future
so now we have 175 items in the block vote. Given it's size, we should split it up and get it out in 3 -4 blocks ASAP for vote after dev days

that leaves us with ~75 tasks I could not block vote. There;s no way we're getting through that. (there's about 50 parked in other places). we have to get through about 30 of them for ballot reasons. I've pushed harder in the block vote on non-ballot stuff.
so we need to ask for comments on the other 40 or so that we won't be getting to. to see if we can move some into the block vote

the other thing is, I'm not going to get everything done. that's already obvious. There's one very big task that I had intended to do before the second ballot: update the R2 <-> R3 maps to R3 <-> R4. That won't be happening

My leaning would be to leave it as a single block vote and schedule it for 2 weeks from Monday. That gives 2.5 weeks to review. Splitting it up into parts doesn't really help And I'd rather know sooner than later if something is being pulled.
In terms of applying changes, non-substantive changes can be made after the ballot opens.

I thought it would help if we split it into :

  • ballot not persusaive of some kind
  • ballot persausive
  • everything else
In terms of applying changes, non-substantive changes can be made after the ballot opens.
even for normative? have we ever done that elsehwere? I think not
We could, but everyone can see the resolution in the block vote list
but not it's ballot status, no?
Non-substantive changes are allowed to be made for "found issues"
In this case, they'd be known issues. And we could even point to them in the ballot if people cared to look.
how can we point to them in the ballot if they're not in the ballot?
We could include a list of gforge links to unapplied non-substantive changes.
THere's 23 MnM tasks... I'm going to set up a block vote there too
I already did for the ready-for-vote ones. Forgot to mark them as BlockVote 1 though
ok I'll use ready-to-vote
I mean I've already sent out a block vote notice. If you add new ones, make them block vote 2 and send a separate email
oh? I didn't see that. ok. I'll do that
ok 9 on our telecon list, and a block vote of 6
existing block vote is 5
Will you send out an email to the list with the second block vote? You know where the block vote transform is?
no. haven't got to the transform bit
FHIR-documents/tracker/tools/TrackerToEmail.xslt
@Lloyd McKenzie Is that likely a generally usable transform (maybe with some customization)?
It's generally useable for FHIR gForge. If you wanted to use it for non-FHIR gForge, customization would be required.
The link to it can be found in the wiki page linked to from the tracker
how do you use this xslt? is there a documented process?
In the wiki. Essentially, filter to the block vote items, do an XML export, run the transform on it. It'll generate both HTML and mediawiki content you can copy & paste
would be nice if someone would add another button that just does that...
If we had the power, we would have...
added GF#14170 to the block vote; that might be controversial?
No objections here...
